body_html: @alextp Thanks for input. Yes, I also did not understand. I thought that default_registry should always include global registry. But that does not seem to be the case. Especially, in nested_function_test of eager:function_test top-level function's flib_defseems to be passed as default_registry to child function.
body_text: @alextp Thanks for input. Yes, I also did not understand. I thought that default_registry should always include global registry. But that does not seem to be the case. Especially, in nested_function_test of eager:function_test top-level function's flib_defseems to be passed as default_registry to child function.
body: @alextp Thanks for input. Yes, I also did not understand. I thought that default_registry should always include global registry. But that does not seem to be the case. Especially, in `nested_function_test` of `eager:function_test` top-level function's `flib_def`seems to be passed as `default_registry` to child function.
